  • Method Details

    • createTeamFromJSON

      public DBTeam createTeamFromJSON(String filename) throws TeamAlreadyExistsException, PlayerWithInvalidNumberException, ExistsUserSameDniException, DniNotCorrectException, ExistsUserSameEmailException, EmailNotCorrectException, PlayerNotFoundException, FileNotFoundException, FormatNotExpectedException
      Method that creates a team and registers it in the DB
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file
      Throws:
      TeamAlreadyExistsException - if the team already exists the program will throw this exception with the message: "You have tried to create a team that already exists!"
      PlayerWithInvalidNumberException - if the player has an invalid number the program will throw this exception with the message: "Tried to register a player with an invalid team number, it must be grater than 0!"
      ExistsUserSameDniException - if the player has the same DNI as another player the program will throw this exception with the message: "There is already a user with the same DNI."
      DniNotCorrectException - if the player has an invalid DNI the program will throw this exception with the message: "The DNI is not correct."
      ExistsUserSameEmailException - if the player has the same email as another player the program will throw this exception with the message: "There is already a user with the same email."
      EmailNotCorrectException - if the player has an invalid email the program will throw this exception with the message: "The email is not correct."
      PlayerNotFoundException - if the player is not found the program will throw this exception with the message: "The player is not found."
      FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found the program will throw this exception with the message: "The file is not found."
      FormatNotExpectedException

    • getAllTeams

      public ArrayList<DBTeam> getAllTeams()
      Method that returns all the teams registered in the DB
      Returns:
      all the teams registered in the DB (ArrayList)

    • getPlayersRegistered

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayersRegistered()
      Method that returns the players registered in the last team created
      Returns:
      the players registered in the last team created (ArrayList)

    • removeTeams

      public void removeTeams(ArrayList<String> teamsNames) throws CouldntRemoveTeamException
      Method that deletes all teams from the database given an arraylist of them
      Parameters:
      teamsNames - names of the teams we want to remove from de database
      Throws:
      CouldntRemoveTeamException - in case it couldn't delete some team

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayersFromATeam(String teamName)
      Method that gets all the players from a team
      Parameters:
      teamName - the name of the team
      Returns:
      ArrayList of players
